Toolbar playground

In the form below you can modify the topbar toolbar. For the icon field, please refer to Icons section

Topbar title
Topbar toolbar items

How to use

Simple topbar

Any element with class c-topbar will receive the topbar style. Topbar title or logo should be set with c-topbar__title class. An optional subtitle can be set using c-topbar__subtitle. Header tags like h1 or h2 are recommended for these last elements. 


        <header class="c-topbar">
            <h1 class="c-topbar__title">
                <img src="mylogo" alt="My App" />
            </h1>

            <h2 class="c-topbar__subtitle">Optional subtitle</h2>
        </header>

An optional back button could be added before the headings, as an archor with the class c-topbar__btn--back. It will appear only for mobile devices. 


        <header class="c-topbar">
            <a href="goBack" class="c-topbar__link c-topbar__btn--back">
                <span class="c-topbar__link-icon">
                    <svg class="o-icon">
                        <use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#u4-icon-topbar--angle-left"></use>
                    </svg>
                </span>
            </a>
            <h1 class="c-topbar__title">
                <img src="mylogo" alt="My App" />
            </h1>
        </header>

Fixed topbar

Just add c-topbar--fixed. The topbar will remain in the same position when the page scrolls. 


        <header class="c-topbar c-topbar--fixed"> …

Topbar with tabs

Any c-tabs element just after the c-topbar will be styled as topbar tabs container 

                <header class="c-topbar">
                    …
                </header>

                <ul class="c-tabs">
                    <li class="c-tabs__tab">
                        <a href="tabLink">All</a>
                    </li>
                    <li class="c-tabs__tab is-active">
                        <a href="tabLink">New</a>
                    </li>
                    <li class="c-tabs__tab">
                        <a href="tabLink">Favorites</a>
                    </li>
                </ul>

Condensed TopBar

Add the modifier class c-topbar--condensed to any topbar to display it with a smaller size. 

                <header class="c-topbar c-topbar--condensed">
                    …
                </header>

A tab panel can be added inside the topbar DOM to create integrated tabs.

                <header class="c-topbar c-topbar--condensed">
                
                    …

                    <h1 class="c-topbar__title">
                        …
                    </h1>

                    <ul class="c-tabs">
                        …
                    </ul>

                    <nav class="c-topbar__toolbar">
                        …
                    </nav>
                </header>

{{ title }}

  • All

Toolbar

Use the class c-topbar__toolbar in order to add a toolbar into the application topbar. The toolbar items should be enclosed into an unordened list. Use the class c-topbar__link-icon to wrap the toolbar item icon, and c-topbar__link-title for the item title. 


            <header class="c-topbar">
                …

                <nav class="c-topbar__toolbar">
                    <ul>
                        <li>
                            <a href="itemLink" class="c-topbar__link">
                                <span class="c-topbar__link-icon">
                                    <svg class="o-icon">
                                        <use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#u4-icon-topbar--user"></use>
                                    </svg>
                                </span>
                                <span class="c-topbar__link-title">Toolbar item title</span>
                            </a>
                        </li>
                        …
                    </ul>
                </nav>
            </header>

An optional item badge can be added to any toolbar item using the classes c-topbar__badge and c-topbar__item--has-badge: 


        <li class="c-topbar__item--has-badge">
            <a href="itemLink" class="c-topbar__link">
                <span class="c-topbar__link-icon">
                    <svg …
                    </svg>
                    <span class="c-topbar__badge">2</span>
                </span>
            </a>
        </li>

The toolbar won't be visible for small devices. For that cases, an expander handle should be added with the class c-topbar__toolbar__expander 


            <nav class="c-topbar__toolbar">
                <a href="#" class="c-topbar__link c-topbar__expander">
                    <span class="c-topbar__link-icon">
                        <svg class="o-icon">
                            <use xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xlink:href="#u4-icon-topbar--plus"></use>
                        </svg>
                    </span>
                </a>

                <ul>
                    …
                </ul>
            </nav>
Centered topbar

Topbar inner content can be centered beyond "x-large" breakpoint using the modifier class c-topbar--centered.

It's compatible with all versions (default size and condensed). Topbar tabs will be centered as well.
